intro: Byrsonima verbascifolia var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smoothleaf jurema, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is known for its ability to thrive in dry, tropical conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
